### Input:
 I think this may be covered under the line item that deals with field renaming when dropping . If so , resolve this as a duplicate of it . from cmvc defect 254303 : notes : < Note by myersdj ( MYERS , JEFFREY D. ) , 2003/06/26 09:49:57 , seq : 1 rel : 0 action : open > Can not perform rename refactor while roundtripping paused Currently the rename option on javabeans is disabled when round tripping is paused . We should be able to rename while round tripping is paused , so that you do n't have to wait for reload from scratch after each rename occurs ( if doing many at once ) . This is related to a customer comment in the newsgroup : Steve Dieke - iacyclone @ yahoo.com This is an open enhancement request for the Visual Editor for Java . I am building a Swing form and it is exceedingly cumborsome using the new Visual Editor for Java . I have 81 swing controls on this form . The form contains various nested JPanels with the controls in them . My problem is re-naming the controls so that when I look at the code I do no see itmes name like things such as jButton1 , jButton2 , jTextField3 ... I am using the new refactoring feature , which I like a lot but when used in conjunction with the Visual Editor for Java , it is a pain . Every time I run the Refactor - > Rename command , the Java Beans view refreshes and expands all items in the list so that every control is visible . I then have to scroll back to the last control I modified and and find the next one . It also takes 15 seconds for the Java Beans view to refresh after the rename is complete . That may not sound like a lot of time but , multiply that by 80+ controls and it adds up . Not to mention the time to scroll back through the JavaBenas view to where you left off to selet the next control . VAJ was much better about the time it took to do this sort of stuff with the VCE . I understand why the Visual Editor for Jave needs to function like this ( I assume b/c the VCE built code on the save where the VEFJ build on demand ) , but any time savings created by the features of the refactoring tool are negated by these drawbacks . Steve
